intro: Tacsonia parritae, commonly known as the Parritae tacsonia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often covered in fine hairs. Tacsonia parritae is adapted to grow in humid, shaded environments, typically found in cloud forests.
